questions.question: What is the first line of the creed?

choices.answer: To lend to those less fortunate a helping hand
To walk in the way of honor, guarding the purity ...
Believing that our given word is binding
To practice day by day, LOVE HONOR TRUTH

questions.question: What is the last line of the creed?

choices.answer: To practice day by day LOVE HONOR TRUTH
Thus being true to the womanhood of love
Thus keeping true to the meaning, spirit & reality of Phi Mu
To lend to the needy a helping hand

questions.question: Name the line after: To serve in the light of truth avoiding egotism, narrowness and scorn

choices.answer: To minister to the needy and unfortunate
To keep our lives gentle, merciful, and just
To be to others what we would they would be to us
To give freely of our sympathies

questions.question: Name the line after: To keep our lives gentle, merciful, and just

choices.answer: Thus being true to the womanhood of love
Thus being true to the womanhood of honor
Thus being true to the womanhood of truth
Thus being true to the womanhood of kindness

questions.question: Name the line after: Being steadfast in every duty small or large

choices.answer: To minister to the needy and unfortunate
To practice day by day love, honor, truth
Believing that our given word is binding
To be to others what we would they would be to us

questions.question: Name the line before: To reverence God as our Maker, striving to serve him in all things

choices.answer: To minister to the needy and unfortunate
To keep our lives gentle, merciful and just
Being steadfast in every duty small or larg
To give freely of our sympathies

questions.question: What are the three ideals of Phi Mu?

choices.answer: Love, Truth, Kindness
Love, Honor, Cake
Love, Honor, Truth
Honor, Kindness, Equality

questions.question: Name the line after: To think of God as a protector and guide of us all

choices.answer: To keep our lives gentle, merciful, and just
To keep 4evr sacred the memory of those we have loved & lost
To keep 4evr sacred the memory of those we have loved
To be to others what we would they would be to us

questions.question: Name the line after: Striving to esteem the inner man above culture, wealth or pedigree

choices.answer: To give freely of our sympathies
To reverence God as our Maker
To minister to the needy and unfortunate
Being honorable, courteous, tender

questions.question: Name the line before: Believing that our given word is binding

choices.answer: To lend to those less fortunate a helping hand
To practice day by day love, honor, truth
Being steadfast in every duty small or large
Being honorable, courteous, tender
